Reviews.Title: It's actually a good camera!
Reviews.Author: Real Raleigh Reviewer
Reviews.Content: In this low-to-medium-end point-and-shoot category you will find pretty hit-and-miss performance. Take for example my recent scathing review of the Nikon Coolpix S3100 - which we purchased and have returned because the performance (speed, focus, etc.) is so abysmally bad that it can't be a real product, it must be defective. Even simple pictures of stationary subjects at 10 feet in broad daylight come out blurry, and the semi-focused pics come out grainy. Absolute junk.By contrast is this nice little device, which we purchased on Amazon at the same time. It has a 3" touchscreen with menus that are easy to use, with very simple and intuitive menus and controls. This is a feature typically only found on slightly higher-end point and shoot cameras, in the $200+ range. It's small and sleek, and while the Nikon has a nice metal body (or at least, the front half), this one has a little bit of a lighter, cheaper, all-plastic body - it feels well-made but it's very very light. Now for the real important thing: does it take good pictures?Yes.Its flash actually lights the scene well and the sensor appears to tick down the sensitivity a little when the flash is in use; the result is that it does a pretty good job with flash photography. However, it seems to take pretty clear, focused pictures even under incandescent light. Sometimes the auto-focus gets a little confused in low light, so it's not 100% perfect, but I've never had a camera that is. About 90-95% of the indoors photos came out clearly, which is quite remarkable for such a small and inexpensive camera.To be perfectly fair and objective, I took this camera and our Nikon Coolpix S3100 (since returned to Amazon) outside and took two shots per camera, of each of five subjects, in the same resolution, at the same time, using the 'auto' mode. I chose the sharper of the two photos from each camera and renamed the file generically. I then brought up the photos on our 1080p 55" TV - the largest-format, highest-resolution screen in the house. I showed them to my wife and asked her to choose "before" and "after", letting her know that I had swapped the order of the pictures randomly (so that A wasn't always the Nikon, B wasn't always the Samsung). In 5 out of 5 cases, she picked (and I agreed) the Samsung's pictures, simply on the focus, color precision and depth of field. The Nikon just can't focus correctly. For example, on the back patio, the kids' tricycle is relatively focused, but the grill right beside it - both near the center of the shot - is entirely blurred out. On the Samsung, both are, as expected, in perfect focus.You can go wrong in the entry-level point-and-shoot category but not with this little guy - it works splendidly, it's budget-friendly, and it has features and some performance that's comparable to other point-and-shoot offerings at twice the price. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: vana conspiciunt "None"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the price! The touch screen is responsive and easy to use. The resolution is amazing for the size, and even the motion shots turn out ok. My only complaint is the zoom; it does not focus well, it really doesn't zoom very far, and really, if you want to zoom in on anything, your better off just walking closer to whatever your trying to capture. The video features are excellent, and i just used it at a horse show where it took excellent videos and action shots (very little blurring). All in all i think its a great camera for the price

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave K in Tucson "VicinTucson"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a cheap replacement for an old Kodak Point and shoot who's battery door failed. So far I am pleased with the practice shots that I took and love the touch screen feature. I hope to add to this on the functionality later.The only complaint is that the camera uses Samsungs squirrely recharge plug - come on Samsung get with it and go with a standard USB.

Reviews.Title: exceed expectations
Reviews.Author: 23435 KC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife for X-mas. We've both been VERY pleased with the camera. The 'autosmart' setting automatically selects the best setting for quick on-the-go pictures. There are PLEANTY of features if you want to get into the technical side of things as well - including up to a 16 second exposure!!! Highly recomend this little guy - very happy!

Reviews.Title: What more could you ask for?
Reviews.Author: Jacob R. Nelson "Consumer Reviews"
Reviews.Content: For a compact camera the Samsung ST95 also packs a punch. It's probably the perfect travel camera as it doesn't skimp on quality or portability.Pros-Very good Macro shots-Some of the filters (vignetting and miniature mode are effective when used properly-Size (pocketable)-Battery life: For a camera with a huge LCD the battery is lasting a long while and can be easily rechargedCons-No viewfinder (what'ya gonna do, they're being phased out)-Sometimes shots come out blurry if you don't time them right. For instance, when you depress the shutter button half way you see the subject coming into clarity and then going blurry again before the shot is taken.-No room for add-onsOverall this camera performs very well. I did a lot of research before settling on this and I'm glad I did so far. Time will tell if this thing continues to perform as it does. I noticed that shooting in "simple shot" mode is often best for matching the brightness and color levels you want. Switch the shooting mode to 10Megapixels and under to save room, I never shoot in 16 megapixel mode, there's no need to.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use right out of the box.  Before buying it, I read the reviews of it so I knew what I was getting.  It's compact and perfect for what we use it for.  I would recommend this camera not just because its ease of use but also the features.  So far, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Easy to learn
Reviews.Author: annieb501
Reviews.Content: Use for work.  Easy to learn how to operate, excellent results.  Quality pictures.  Would recommend to anyone who is looking to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera
Reviews.Author: asmaa makhoukhi
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera, I have had it for one year now and it works perfectly. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Author: Kelli
Reviews.Content: The camera is great and takes amazing pictures, but when it actually takes the picture it's very delayed... it's like saying, "say cheese!" and then count to 5 and THEN it takes the picture. If you are taking posed pictures, it's perfect... but for any action shot with kids playing, pets, or you're just being goofy, you don't want this camera

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: Pedro Blanco
Reviews.Content: excellent product, the better. is very good, I recommend it. is very fast, very comfortable, very nice. Unexpected gem machine, the photos are perfect

Reviews.Title: Great for the new teen photographer
Reviews.Author: greenwood106
Reviews.Content: Have a young teen interested in photography casually or looking for a solid digital to snap pics for Facebook, Instagram, etc?  This is a perfect camera for you.  All the benefits of higher price point SLRs, but without the price point.This camera has worked perfectly for my daughter, and I'm sure it would for your kids as well.  Why spend the money on a DSLR before you know how they will handle a smaller version?  Give them a chance to see if the bug of photography will take before making that investment.  Good value, good results, and a great first step.

Reviews.Title: Performance not as expected
Reviews.Author: Sundayose
Reviews.Content: The sensor of the touch pad does not function up to the expectations. It's abit slow.Photos taken in the dark aren't clear enough.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Janee M Perez
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research before purchasing this camera.  I was looking for a very small, compact camera in a specific price range that would fit into my purse but yet provide some of the features I had in my Nikon S5000.  The touch screen is fairly easy to use but usually requires the use of a touch pen (which is included but sometimes difficult to get to quickly).  The pictures come out very well considering the price of this camera, however I have noticed that many of my pictures taken with the flash cause red eye. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazon is recommending add-ons that don't go with the camera
Reviews.Author: Sonya M. Miller "sonya"
Reviews.Content: Gave camera to my niece today for Christmas and we realized the external memory card that Amazon offers as part of the bundle doesn't even fit in the camera!!  Now she is traveling tomorrow and only has the small internal 10MB card.  Amazon update your website, you have to use a MICRO SDHC card.Camera is very Lightweight and so far easy to use other than this Amazon created issue.
